word_mean: 炎〔症〕：组织损伤或破坏所激起的局限性保护性反应，以破坏、稀释或隔离有害因子和受伤的组织。表现为痛、热、红、肿及功能丧失的急性症状。组织学上，包括一系列复杂表现，如小动脉、毛细管和小静脉扩张，血管渗透性增加，血流加快，液体渗出(包括血浆蛋白)，和白细胞进入炎性病灶等
机体对各种物理、化学、生物等有害刺激所产生的一种以防御为主的病理反应。

sentence.Network_en: Aloe may have an analgesic effect on inflammation and minor skin irritations.
sentence.Network_cn: 芦荟可能对发炎以及轻微的皮肤炎症具有镇痛作用。

sentence.Network_en: This is an irritation and inflammation of the edge of the eyelid.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是眼睑边缘红肿发炎的症状。

sentence.Network_en: Many babies develop a mild inflammation in the eyes a few days after birth.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多婴儿出生几天后眼睛有轻度炎症.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin inflammatio(n-), from the verb inflammare (see inflame)

entry.def: An inflammation is a painful redness or swelling of a part of your body that results from an infection, injury, or illness.

example.ex: The drug can cause inflammation of the liver.

means.word_mean: 1. a response of body tissues to injury or irritation; characterized by pain and swelling and redness and heat
2. the state of being emotionally aroused and worked up;

sentences.sentence: "his face was flushed with excitement and his hands trembled"
"he tried to calm those who were in a state of extreme inflammation"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of setting on fire or catching fire
